description: From Latin lambēns, present participle of lambō (“lick”).

adjectives.description: lambent (comparative more lambent, superlative most lambent)

entries.meaning: Brushing or flickering gently over a surface.
examples: No foe to man / Lurks in the ſerpent now: the mother ſees, / And ſmiles to ſee, her infant's playful hand / Stretch'd forth to dally with the creſted worm, / To ſtroke his azure neck, or to receive / The lambent homage of his arrowy tongue.

entries.meaning: Glowing or luminous, but lacking heat.
examples: The lambent glow of fireflies delighted the children.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Exhibiting lightness or brilliance of wit; clever or witty without unkindness.
